programme.title: Próba niewinności Agathy Christie
programme.desc: Boże Narodzenie 1954 roku. Zamożna filantropka Rachel Argyll (Anna Chancellor) zostaje zamordowana w swojej rodzinnej posiadłości. Podejrzenia zostają skierowane na jej adoptowanego syna, Jacka (Anthony Boyle), który trafia do aresztu. W prowadzonym śledztwie pojawia się jednak coraz więcej wątpliwości. Trzymająca w napięciu adaptacja prozy mistrzyni gatunku - Agathy Christie.

programme.title: ABC Agathy Christie
programme.desc: Rok 1933. Emerytowany belgijski detektyw Herkules Poirot (John Malkovich) stara się wytropić wyrafinowanego seryjnego zabójcę, który wysyła tajemnicze listy podpisane "ABC". Śledczy musi je rozszyfrować, aby odkryć tożsamość niebezpiecznego przestępcy. Wspiera go inspektor Crome (Rubert Grint). Trzymająca w napięciu adaptacja prozy mistrzyni gatunku - Agathy Christie - z nominowanym w karierze dwukrotnie do Oscara ("Miejsca w sercu", "Na linii ognia") Johnem Malkovichem.

programme.title: Na strajk!
programme.desc: Dzień z życia 19-letniego Karola, który opiekuje się dziadkiem chorym na alzheimera. Niebawem chłopak poznaje tajemnicę rodzinną związaną z dramatycznymi wydarzeniami podczas stoczniowych strajków w grudniu 1970 roku. Odkryta przeszłość zmusza go do podjęcia najważniejszej decyzji w życiu.

programme.title: We mnie
programme.desc: Sandra (Małgorzata Gorol) świętuje swój wieczór panieński. Zbliża się dzień ślubu, ale przedtem musi poddać się aborcji - płód ma wady genetyczne. Do szpitala jedzie z nią narzeczony. Z każdą kolejną minutą mężczyzna wydaje się Sandrze coraz bardziej obcy. Po zabiegu kobieta postanawia szczerze z nim porozmawiać.

programme.title: Szczescie swiata
Szczęście świata
programme.desc:
Szczescie swiata: Directed by Michal Rosa. With Karolina Gruszka, Mateusz Lickindorf, Grzegorz Palkowski, Dariusz Chojnacki. A journalist from Warsaw travels to Silesia and manages to find a tenement house full of exceptional inhabitants." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6104188/","name":"Szczescie swiata","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDQ3OTUzZWYtYTFlNi00Y2FhLWFmMDEtMGNkOGU2OTZlYWVjL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A journalist from Warsaw travels to Silesia and manages to find a tenement house full of exceptional inhabitants.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6104188/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Red-125"},"dateCreated":"2017-11-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent--but unusual--Polish film","reviewBody":"The Polish film Szczescie swiata (2016) was shown in the U.S. with the title The Happiness of the World. It was written and directed by Michal Rosa.

The movie is set in 1939 in an apartment house in Silesia--an area of Poland close to the German border. The apartment house itself is unusual. It's clearly not far from a city, but it sits in lonely isolation in a field. It's a very upscale place, and most of the people who live in it are middle or upper class. It's not what we in the U.S. would call a tenement, with poor people making ends meet. It's very elegant.

The plot centers around a journalist from a large city who is sent to the area to track down an elusive bestselling author. This search is more or less just a way to begin the story. When the reporter arrives, his first meeting is with the beautiful Róza, portrayed by Karolina Gruszka. 

Róza has many charms, which she openly displays to the reporter, as well as to any other man who joins her. In turn, director Rosa openly displays Gruszka's charms to his audience. We can all see why she's called "The Happiness of the World."

The movie plot is actually a series of vignettes. Each inhabitant of the apartment building has her or his own story. To a certain extent, the stories intersect, because all of the characters live in the same place. The pivotal figure in all of this is Róza. Karolina Gruszka isn't just another pretty face. She's an extraordinary actor, who is well known in Poland. The movie will rise or fall depending on Gruszka's presence on the screen. She's great, and the film rises accordingly.

We watched this movie in Rochester's excellent Little Theatre. It will work well on the small screen. The film was shown at the outstanding 2017 Rochester Polish Film Festival. After the film, director Rosa was in attendance for a Q&A session. (He doesn't speak English, but the interpreter who worked with him was superb.) My compliments to the PFF for bringing the director to Rochester.

For me, the most striking aspect of the Q&A was Mr. Rosa's discussion of magical realism. I believe that everyone in the audience noted magical realism in the movie. Director Rosa says that it isn't magical realism--it's just realism. I'm not sure if he was joking with us when he said that, or whether he actually believes that the type of events he shows us aren't magical at all. You'll have to watch the movie to see what you think about this realism.

P.S. The Happiness of the World has a dismal IMDb rating of 6.3. It's a much, much better movie than that. Again, you'll have to watch the movie and then decide for yourself.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":126,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2016-12-23","keywords":"silesia,bathtub,femme fatale","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0344734/","name":"Karolina Gruszka"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8475166/","name":"Mateusz Lickindorf"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2707614/","name":"Grzegorz Palkowski"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740853/","name":"Michal Rosa"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0330220/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0577510/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740853/","name":"Michal Rosa"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

The movie is set in 1939 in an apartment house in Silesia--an area of Poland close to the German border. The apartment house itself is unusual. programme.title: Raoul Taburin

Raoul Taburin
programme.desc: Raoul Taburin: Directed by Pierre Godeau. With Benoît Poelvoorde, Edouard Baer, Suzanne Clément, Victor Assié. Raoul Taburin is the story of a little boy who has grown up without knowing how to ride a bike. The story of an immense misunderstanding lived as a curse. An impostor despite himself." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7831674/","name":"Raoul Taburin","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjc2NzY1ZTQtN2YyYi00MWJkLThlODUtYTM5ZDg2NjFiMWY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTc5OTMwOTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Raoul Taburin is the story of a little boy who has grown up without knowing how to ride a bike. The story of an immense misunderstanding lived as a curse. An impostor despite himself.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7831674/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"FrenchEddieFelson"},"dateCreated":"2019-04-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"A humble family movie","reviewBody":"A film gathering Benoît Poelvoorde, Edouard Baer, Suzanne Clément, and inspired from a comic strip of the genial Sempé, it's clearly an offer you can't refuse! Nevertheless, processing a comic into a movie is usually a perilous exercise, due to the probable distorsion of the global atmosphere, with a wide spectrum of divergent opinions on this particular subject. In my humble opinion, the result is rather successful thanks to the magic complicity of the duet Poelvoorde / Baer. I was particularly sensitive to these themes: simplicity, friendship, humility, benevolence and love. A mature lady approaches a young actor and offers him a great amount of money to get acquainted with her lonely daughter, who suffers of an incurable illness. Eventually a true romance emerges, as mother has secret feelings for the man, while he truly falls in love with the daughter. IMDb data; ttnr: 0155479, Title: Les ailes de la colombe, --- Description: Les ailes de la colombe: Directed by Benoît Jacquot. With Isabelle Huppert, Dominique Sanda, Michele Placido, Loleh Bellon. A mature lady approaches a young actor and offers him a great amount of money to get acquainted with her lonely daughter, who suffers of an incurable illness. Eventually a true romance emerges, as mother has secret feelings for the man, while he truly falls in love with the daughter. After the expected death of the daughter, the man leaves in grief rejecting the money, and the mature woman stays in deep loneliness, trying to cope with a double loss." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0155479/","name":"Les ailes de la colombe","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDVjMTYzYTYtNmJlOS00NmNjLTg1YWEtOWUyZTUyOTM2YTRmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzU0NzkwMDg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mature lady approaches a young actor and offers him a great amount of money to get acquainted with her lonely daughter, who suffers of an incurable illness. programme.title: Euphoria
Euforia
Euphoria
programme.desc:
Euphoria: Directed by Lisa Langseth. With Eva Green, Alicia Vikander, Charlotte Rampling, Charles Dance. Sisters in conflict travelling through Europe toward a mystery destination." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5698320/","name":"Euphoria","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmVhYTk5NDktMThjNC00MDg0LTg3OTEtOTZkNzMyMGE5ZDU1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjI2ODA4MDU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Sisters in conflict travelling through Europe toward a mystery destination.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5698320/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"zolizolidus-35734"},"dateCreated":"2018-02-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"A dark story","reviewBody":"This one is so difficult to review and write about without spoiling it. 

I really like the story and all the actors show up and makes this an interesting story to follow. 

I never seen Eva Green in such a dark character like this. I really enjoy what she puts on the screen but many time I have to think when I watch the movie. Is that really her ? 

Charles Dance character is fantastic to watch. I really enjoy the talk he have with Alicia Vikanders character aside of his last scenes. 

The photo is pretty and the music works well. 

This aint a happy story to watch so if you are looking for something to cheer you up, this aint it. Im not much for taking sides in the controversial subject that this movie is about, but I figured that I really dont have to. 

I can sit down and just take in the movie as it is. 

I watched this at the Dragon in Göteborg at the Göteborg fesival and it was a great joy to listen to Alicia Vikander and Lisa Langseth doing a Q and A about the movie. 

This was the third movie with Alicia and Lisa working together and the fist international movie for Lisa.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4023,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Adventure","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2018-02-02","keywords":"forest,euthanasia,dance,restaurant,wanting to die","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1461763097","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDAzMjJkZGMtMzhjMi00NDQ2LWFmNzEtMDg0Y2IzY2FhOGNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDAzMjJkZGMtMzhjMi00NDQ2LWFmNzEtMDg0Y2IzY2FhOGNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1200692/","name":"Eva Green"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2539953/","name":"Alicia Vikander"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001648/","name":"Charlotte Rampling"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2272926/","name":"Lisa Langseth"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0337495/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0588633/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0588634/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2272926/","name":"Lisa Langseth"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: To, co zostaje
programme.desc: Marianna (Marta Ścisłowicz) i Jan (Piotr Czarniecki) wiodą szczęśliwe życie na wsi w północno-wschodniej Polsce. Pewnego dnia kobieta musi stawić czoła niespodziewanej śmierci męża. Wyrzuty sumienia i nagła strata sprawiają, że potrzebuje czasu, żeby pożegnać ukochanego. Zamyka się z jego ciałem w domu. Jej zachowanie spotyka się z niezrozumieniem mieszkańców wioski.

credits.actor: Marta Ścisłowicz
Piotr Czarniecki
Michał Jaros
Elżbieta Studniarek
Natan Kryczyński

programme.title: Memory: The Origins of Alien
Wspomnienia: Geneza „Obcego”
Memory: The Origins of Alien
programme.desc: Memory: The Origins of Alien: Directed by Alexandre O. Philippe. With Bijan Aalam, Tim Boxell, Axelle Carolyn, Veronica Cartwright. An in-depth voyage into the sci-fi film "Alien" with the visionary filmmakers who created it. See how one of the most terrifying movies of all time came to life 40 years ago, inspired by ancient mythology and our universal fears." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8974964/","name":"Memory: The Origins of Alien","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzZjZWZhOWUtMGFkMS00NGRhLThmN2EtNmZlMTRkOWRlMzQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDExMzMxNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"An in-depth voyage into the sci-fi film "Alien" with the visionary filmmakers who created it. See how one of the most terrifying movies of all time came to life 40 years ago, inspired by ancient mythology and our universal fears.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8974964/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Huud"},"dateCreated":"2019-09-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"What a missed Opportunity","reviewBody":"Well, the only GOOD news is, hopefully one day someone will take the helm and do a truly comprehensive documentary about "Alien". This is NOT it. "Alien" certainly deserves it. While this documentary may include some existential and interesting contributions not before stated it certainly lacks in giving credit where credit is due. Alien is an artistic endeavor and unfortunately leaves out a whole lot of artists involved. Where was Ron Cobb (set design) and Mobius (costume, and ship design). Oh, no. Those were all RIDLEY's ideas (according to the documentary). And what about POST PRODUCTION? Ben Burtt is mentioned ONCE and NO mention at all about music and this is what really amazed me, NO MENTION about editorial. If you are a true "Alien" fan then you will have heard MOST of what is in this already. Give it a pass and hope for somebody later to pick up and carry the torch.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2564,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Documentary","Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2019-10-04","keywords":"francis bacon,reenactment,facehugger,film history,film making","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3283468057","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODlhMzA2NGMtYWUyNC00YjE5LWIwZWEtMzQ2ODkyN2M5ZWMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODlhMzA2NGMtYWUyNC00YjE5LWIwZWEtMzQ2ODkyN2M5ZWMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"The untold origin story behind Ridley Scott's 'Alien' - rooted in Greek and Egyptian mythologies, underground comics, the art of Francis Bacon, and the dark visions of Dan O'Bannon and H.R. Giger. A contemplation on the symbiotic collaborative process of movie-making, the power of myth, and our collective unconscious."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3865525/","name":"Bijan Aalam"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0101521/","name":"Tim Boxell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2130745/","name":"Axelle Carolyn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1465431/","name":"Alexandre O. programme.title: The New Daughter
Córka
The New Daughter
programme.desc:
The New Daughter: Directed by Luiso Berdejo. With Kevin Costner, Ivana Baquero, Samantha Mathis, Gattlin Griffith. A single father moves his two children to rural South Carolina, only to watch his daughter exhibit increasingly strange behavior." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0951335/","name":"The New Daughter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNTQ2MzM4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTgzNDcyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A single father moves his two children to rural South Carolina, only to watch his daughter exhibit increasingly strange behavior.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0951335/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Samiam3"},"dateCreated":"2010-05-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Spooky story done badly","reviewBody":"Up to a certain point in The New Daughter, I was reminded of Dragonfly. Both are low budget Costner films about a man dealing with a family loss which has a haunting outcome. It has been a while since I saw Dragonfly. Nobody thought it was any good, but it is way better than this film. To start with the obvious, The New Daughter represents what may be Costner's most lazy performance. It seems he has no interest in the story whatsoever. After a while the Dragonfly connection starts to fade away, and the movie turns into something else, something worse unfortunately. The New Daughter is torpid, and is bogged down by too much content, and not enough suspense or intelligent dialogue.

If I am gonna give the film any credit, it would be for photography. This is a gorgeously shot film, where the nights are cold, eerie and evocative, and the safety of home is warm, glowing and golden. The best shot in the film is the last one, which barely makes up for the utter stupidity of the ending. There is much left to explain, but in the end, I don't really care.

The New Daughter, is a spooky story, which is occasionally interesting but is less so than it is sloppily executed, badly acted, and not worth your money.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14887,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2010-10-07","keywords":"mound,ant farm,indian burial ground,shotgun,father daughter relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The New Daughter","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2034828313","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0MDM1ODA0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODQwNDczMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0MDM1ODA0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODQwNDczMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A single father moves his two children to rural South Carolina, only to watch his daughter exhibit increasingly strange behavior. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000126/","name":"Kevin Costner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1419440/","name":"Ivana Baquero"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000526/","name":"Samantha Mathis"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1084937/","name":"Luiso Berdejo"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076476/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0290504/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2092862/","name":"John Travis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2391938/","name":"John Connolly"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0951335, Title: The New Daughter, --- Description: The New Daughter: Directed by Luiso Berdejo. With Kevin Costner, Ivana Baquero, Samantha Mathis, Gattlin Griffith. A single father moves his two children to rural South Carolina, only to watch his daughter exhibit increasingly strange behavior." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0951335/","name":"The New Daughter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNTQ2MzM4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTgzNDcyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A single father moves his two children to rural South Carolina, only to watch his daughter exhibit increasingly strange behavior.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0951335/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Samiam3","dateCreated":"2010-05-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Spooky story done badly","reviewBody":"Up to a certain point in The New Daughter, I was reminded of Dragonfly. Both are low budget Costner films about a man dealing with a family loss which has a haunting outcome. It has been a while since I saw Dragonfly. Nobody thought it was any good, but it is way better than this film. To start with the obvious, The New Daughter represents what may be Costner's most lazy performance. It seems he has no interest in the story whatsoever. After a while the Dragonfly connection starts to fade away, and the movie turns into something else, something worse unfortunately. The New Daughter is torpid, and is bogged down by too much content, and not enough suspense or intelligent dialogue.

If I am gonna give the film any credit, it would be for photography. This is a gorgeously shot film, where the nights are cold, eerie and evocative, and the safety of home is warm, glowing and golden. The best shot in the film is the last one, which barely makes up for the utter stupidity of the ending. There is much left to explain, but in the end, I don't really care.

The New Daughter, is a spooky story, which is occasionally interesting but is less so than it is sloppily executed, badly acted, and not worth your money.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14887,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2010-10-07","keywords":"mound,ant farm,indian burial ground,shotgun,father daughter relationship","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The New Daughter","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2034828313","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0MDM1ODA0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODQwNDczMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0MDM1ODA0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODQwNDczMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A single father moves his two children to rural South Carolina, only to watch his daughter exhibit increasingly strange behavior. programme.title: The Children Act
The Lodgers. Przeklęci
The Lodgers
programme.desc: The Children Act: Directed by Richard Eyre. With Emma Thompson, Stanley Tucci, Jason Watkins, Fionn Whitehead. As her marriage crumbles, a judge must decide a case involving a teenage boy who is refusing a blood transfusion on religious principle." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6040662/","name":"The Children Act","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODUwOTk1MzI3NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTI4NDE3NTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"As her marriage crumbles, a judge must decide a case involving a teenage boy who is refusing a blood transfusion on religious principle.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6040662/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Kumarh02"},"dateCreated":"2018-09-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not a 'must watch' tower","reviewBody":"The trailer really wets the appetite and if like me, you were expecting a lengthy legal battle with a dose of moral dilemma and lashings of emotion, you will be disappointed. The JW blood element is short and fleeting as the film concentrated more on the marriage problems between ET & ST, who perform fantastically as ever btw, and the wild infatuations of a confused boy. There was some misrepresentation of JW's, the Kingdom Hall didn't look like any I had ever set foot in, it painted a biased picture of people's interpretation of faith and there language and terminology felt archaic and old testamenty. There are few a divisive topics as refusing blood transfusions for minors based on religious faith and this particular showing didn't leave me or my party much to deliberate on after the credits. Overall, a missed opportunity and a waste of a fine cast.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12338,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-08-24","keywords":"female judge,husband wife relationship,teenage boy,teenager,17 year old","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2677390105","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGIzYmNjOGItNWY1ZC00ZmI5LWFhMGMtZTI0OGMwYTczNmE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGIzYmNjOGItNWY1ZC00ZmI5LWFhMGMtZTI0OGMwYTczNmE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"As her marriage to Jack (Stanley Tucci) flounders, eminent High Court judge Fiona Maye (Emma Thompson) has a life-changing decision to make at work - should she force a teenage boy, Adam (Fionn Whitehead), to have the blood transfusion that will save his life? Her unorthodox visit to his hospital bedside has a profound impact on them both, stirring strong new emotions in the boy and long-buried feelings in her."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000668/","name":"Emma Thompson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001804/","name":"Stanley Tucci"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0914327/","name":"Jason Watkins"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0264236/","name":"Richard Eyre"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0209419/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0251858/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0568605/","name":"Ian McEwan"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Cały ten horror
programme.desc: Dziennikarz Tal Zimerman, znawca horroru w powieści, kinie i innych elementach kultury, zgłębia zagadnienia związane z tym tematem. W rozmowach z reżyserami, aktorami, a także pisarzami dąży do ustalenia, dlaczego ludzie lubią uczucie strachu, czy oglądanie przerażających fabuł potęguje lęki, czy może ma działanie terapeutyczne.

programme.title: Winchester
Dom, który zbudował Jack
The House That Jack Built
programme.desc: Winchester: Directed by Michael Spierig, Peter Spierig. With Helen Mirren, Sarah Snook, Finn Scicluna-O'Prey, Jason Clarke. Ensconced in her sprawling San Jose, California mansion, eccentric firearm heiress Sarah Winchester (Dame Helen Mirren) believes she is haunted by the souls of people killed by the Winchester repeating rifle." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1072748/","name":"Winchester","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI2OWE5OGItMTE4Yi00ZmIzLThjZDctNTU1OTMxMTc3Yjg4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjM4NTM5NDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ensconced in her sprawling San Jose, California mansion, eccentric firearm heiress Sarah Winchester (Dame Helen Mirren) believes she is haunted by the souls of people killed by the Winchester repeating rifle.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1072748/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ryslocum"},"dateCreated":"2018-02-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not a mindless horror movie, but still not a smart one.","reviewBody":"It is better than most "Paranormal Activity" sequels in regards that the make-up effects are very well done. The biggest flaw with the movie is the dialogue. The dialogue, for a lack of a better word, is just plain corny. I struggle to enjoy a movie with horrible dialogue, but if you can get past that flaw you should enjoy this movie very much.\n\nThere are multiple jumpscares throughout the movie which did cause audience member to jump and gasp. The scenery of the movie is my favorite part, as the scenery is what made me feel uneasy with fear. The lighting of the scenes are perfect and the re-creation of the supposedly horrifying house are gripping. If you are easily scared you should have a blast with this movie! For horror fans that are looking for some exceptional horror, this movie is not for you.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":32595,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama","Horror"],"datePublished":"2018-02-02","keywords":"ghost,winchester house,widower,gothic horror,haunted house","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Tease","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2287974681","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU5MDA2NjE3MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjEyMDEwNDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU5MDA2NjE3MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjEyMDEwNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"On an isolated stretch of land 50 miles outside of San Francisco sits the most haunted house in the world. Built by Sarah Winchester, heiress to the Winchester fortune, it is a house that knows no end. Constructed in an incessant twenty-four hour a day, seven day a week mania for decades, it stands seven stories tall and contains hundreds of rooms. To the outsider it looks like a monstrous monument to a disturbed woman's madness. But Sarah is not building for herself, for her niece or for the brilliant Doctor Eric Price whom she has summoned to the house. She is building a prison, an asylum for hundreds of vengeful ghosts, and the most terrifying among them have a score to settle with the Winchesters..."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000545/","name":"Helen Mirren"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3512758/","name":"Sarah Snook"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7073477/","name":"Finn Scicluna-O'Prey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1294961/","name":"Michael Spierig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1294962/","name":"Peter Spierig"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047306/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0380601/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0215453/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1129343/","name":"Tom Vaughan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1294961/","name":"Michael Spierig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1294962/","name":"Peter Spierig"}],"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Proste rzeczy: Directed by Grzegorz Zariczny. With Blazej Kitowski, Magdalena Sztorc, Tomasz Schimscheiner, Alicja Kitowska. programme.title: Rykoszety
programme.desc: Polska, 1982 rok. Nastroje społeczne stają się coraz bardziej napięte. Dwóch braci, będących górnikami, ma odmienne zdanie dotyczące postawy, jaką należy przyjąć w obliczu komunistycznego systemu. Janek (Stanisław Linowski) angażuje się w działania podziemia na rzecz demokracji. Tadek (Tomasz Schuchardt) natomiast woli zachować neutralność. Między mężczyznami pogłębia się konflikt.

programme.desc: Abdellah (Fouad Oughaou) jest młodym pasterzem mieszkającym w górach. Chłopak musi się przedrzeć przez potężne zwały śniegu, aby zdobyć pożywienie i uratować swoje bydło. W końcu udaje mu się dotrzeć do wioski. Napotyka tam nadprzyrodzone zjawisko.

programme.title: Di jiu tianchang
Żegnaj, mój synu
Di Jiu Tian Chang
programme.desc:
Di jiu tianchang: Directed by Xiaoshuai Wang. With Jingchun Wang, Mei Yong, Xi Qi, Roy Wang. Two married couples adjust to the vast social and economic changes taking place in China from the 1980s to the present." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9581076/","name":"Di jiu tianchang","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDQ2OTcwYTQtYmViZS00MjkzLWIwNTAtODUwMmJkYjZhMDE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzI1NzMxNzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two married couples adjust to the vast social and economic changes taking place in China from the 1980s to the present.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9581076/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"liuruiorp"},"dateCreated":"2019-12-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A dreamy observation of a changing nation","reviewBody":"In very many ways this film is almost a reboot of Zhang Yimou's film To Live, from 1994, which tells the many trials and tribulations of a family from the founding of the People's Republic in 1949 to the end of the Cultural Revolution in 1976. So Long My Son picks up that chronological baton, and tells a story about family bonds, the meaning of friendship and what constitutes our morals and ethics through the last 30/40 years of Chinese history, from a stilted, materially basic time of 1980 through to the hypermodernity of China in the 2010s.

In the same way To Live aimed thinly disguised critiques at the Chinese government's policies through showing its impact on ordinary people, So Long My Son fires a number of shots too and it's in fact a little surprising to me some of these have been overlooked by the censors. The most obvious of them is the criticism of the one child policy, but hidden in there too are mentions of the privatisation of state owned industries in the early 90s and the mass redundancies that went with them, as well as criticism of the wealth inequality of modern China that has ensued from the market economy transition of the 80s and 90s.

I'm unsure if this was a problem specific to the release version I saw, though I have seen other reviews saying the plot was hard to follow, but I noticed that the English subtitles was often only translating about 1/5 of the dialogue in Mandarin. As a speaker of both, I followed the plot and characters quite easily, but can absolutely understand why many reviewers and comments have said they found the characters and plots hard to distinguish if the subtitling was a problem. However, with one eye on the subtitles, I think the fact they were missing a lot of the Mandarin dialogue would have created a really dreamy plotline that complements well the cinematographic style deployed - long panoramic shots that suddenly cut into a character's perspective; languid sequences that soak in the environment; and shots designed to make the audience feel voyeurs in a private situation.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3740,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-03-22","keywords":"china,non linear,nonlinear timeline,hospital,loss of son","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OVS]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1042071321","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZThlNmFjNjAtNjkwZS00NTU1LWJkM2ItZGIyNmVlZDRmMGM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZThlNmFjNjAtNjkwZS00NTU1LWJkM2ItZGIyNmVlZDRmMGM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4592524/","name":"Jingchun Wang"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3619308/","name":"Mei Yong"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5035471/","name":"Xi Qi"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911075/","name":"Xiaoshuai Wang"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0514744/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4461717/","name":"Mei Ah"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911075/","name":"Xiaoshuai Wang"}],"duration":"PT3H5M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Glass Castle
Szklany zamek
The Glass Castle
programme.desc: The Glass Castle: Directed by Destin Daniel Cretton. With Brie Larson, Woody Harrelson, Naomi Watts, Ella Anderson. A young girl comes of age in a dysfunctional family of nonconformist nomads with a mother who's an eccentric artist and an alcoholic father who would stir the children's imagination with hope as a distraction to their poverty." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2378507/","name":"The Glass Castle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2Nzk0MDE3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTI0ODc0MjI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young girl comes of age in a dysfunctional family of nonconformist nomads with a mother who's an eccentric artist and an alcoholic father who would stir the children's imagination with hope as a distraction to their poverty.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2378507/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"reverendlinneken"},"dateCreated":"2017-08-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good acting, lacking focus","reviewBody":"The acting and writing for this movie are great, however, I think it missed the mark in terms of what of this incredible story the screen writers chose to focus on. I read the book as an amazing story of resilience, and while the film certainly didn't shy from the fact that Walls thrived despite the neglect and emotional abuse she endured as a child, it played more like a story about her relationship with her father than as a personal story about her tenacity to survive despite it all. I found the book inspiring. The movie didn't inspire as much as it pulled the heart strings. In the end her parents looked a bit too sympathetic, and I left the theater feeling that us viewers were robbed of some of the most raw and telling details her of her childhood, the details that best illustrated just how trying and unique her life was growing up. In all, though I thought the acting was great, I think the meat of Jeanette's personal story of transformation was sacrificed to make space for telling the specific story of her relationship with her father.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":31980,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2017-08-11","keywords":"child abuse,restaurant,painting,hospital,alcoholic","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer With Director's Commentary","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1948498201","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmQxNWI4OGYtZmRjZi00ZjY5LWFlYzEtOGM4YTZiNzMyYzE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjMwMzc3MjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmQxNWI4OGYtZmRjZi00ZjY5LWFlYzEtOGM4YTZiNzMyYzE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjMwMzc3MjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Director Destin Daniel Cretton talks to IMDb about some of the choices he made in bringing Jeannette Walls' emotionally challenging journey to the big screen in 'The Glass Castle'"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0488953/","name":"Brie Larson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000437/","name":"Woody Harrelson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0915208/","name":"Naomi Watts"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2308774/","name":"Destin Daniel Cretton"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0610132/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0313933/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2308774/","name":"Destin Daniel Cretton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6150131/","name":"Andrew Lanham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1890456/","name":"Jeannette Walls"}],"duration":"PT2H7M"}</script><metacontent="

A young girl comes of age in a dysfunctional family of nonconformist nomads with a mother who's an eccentric artist and an alcoholic father who would stir the children's imagination with hope as a distraction to their poverty." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2378507/","name":"The Glass Castle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2Nzk0MDE3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTI0ODc0MjI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young girl comes of age in a dysfunctional family of nonconformist nomads with a mother who's an eccentric artist and an alcoholic father who would stir the children's imagination with hope as a distraction to their poverty.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2378507/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"reverendlinneken","dateCreated":"2017-08-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good acting, lacking focus","reviewBody":"The acting and writing for this movie are great, however, I think it missed the mark in terms of what of this incredible story the screen writers chose to focus on. I read the book as an amazing story of resilience, and while the film certainly didn't shy from the fact that Walls thrived despite the neglect and emotional abuse she endured as a child, it played more like a story about her relationship with her father than as a personal story about her tenacity to survive despite it all. I found the book inspiring. The movie didn't inspire as much as it pulled the heart strings. In the end her parents looked a bit too sympathetic, and I left the theater feeling that us viewers were robbed of some of the most raw and telling details her of her childhood, the details that best illustrated just how trying and unique her life was growing up. In all, though I thought the acting was great, I think the meat of Jeanette's personal story of transformation was sacrificed to make space for telling the specific story of her relationship with her father.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":31980,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2017-08-11","keywords":"child abuse,restaurant,painting,hospital,alcoholic","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer With Director's Commentary","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1948498201","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmQxNWI4OGYtZmRjZi00ZjY5LWFlYzEtOGM4YTZiNzMyYzE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjMwMzc3MjE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmQxNWI4OGYtZmRjZi00ZjY5LWFlYzEtOGM4YTZiNzMyYzE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjMwMzc3MjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Director Destin Daniel Cretton talks to IMDb about some of the choices he made in bringing Jeannette Walls' emotionally challenging journey to the big screen in 'The Glass Castle'","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0488953/","name":"Brie Larson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000437/","name":"Woody Harrelson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0915208/","name":"Naomi Watts"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2308774/","name":"Destin Daniel Cretton"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0610132/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0313933/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2308774/","name":"Destin Daniel Cretton","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6150131/","name":"Andrew Lanham","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1890456/","name":"Jeannette Walls"],"duration":"PT2H7M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Book of Life
W dobrej wierze
The Good Lie
programme.desc:
The Book of Life: Directed by Jorge R. Gutiérrez. With Diego Luna, Zoe Saldana, Channing Tatum, Ron Perlman. Manolo, a young man who is torn between fulfilling the expectations of his family and following his heart, embarks on an adventure that spans three fantastic worlds where he must face his greatest fears." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2262227/","name":"The Book of Life","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzOTgzNDYzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTgxMTkyMjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Manolo, a young man who is torn between fulfilling the expectations of his family and following his heart, embarks on an adventure that spans three fantastic worlds where he must face his greatest fears.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2262227/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rgkarim"},"dateCreated":"2014-10-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fantastic Halloween Fun! Superb Animation","reviewBody":"It's October and it is usually the time for Halloween themed movies. Unfortunately for us, Halloween has been reduced to cheap horrors, or repetitive thrillers that are a bit of a bore. This year has been slightly different, but this reviewer would like the studios to go back in the past and pull some more seasonal themes to entertain us. Well, someone got my vibe, because my last review is on a film that captures the festive fun that Halloween is for the young and young at heart. So sit back my friends and catch my latest review on the animated feature The Book of Life. 

I'll start this review with talking about the story. The Book of Life has a fantastic tale that centers on the typical complication of a love triangle between characters Manolo (Diego Luna), Maria (Zoe Saldana), and Joaquin (Channing Tatum). Now we know the typical elements involved in this type of plot, but this film deviates from the typical and gives a little more pep around the story. From the start you get the backstory on each character, and the individual struggles they each face. Then they take these qualities and exploit them by bringing in the two masters of the underworld, who make a wager as to who will win the girl. The result of this wager, makes for an interesting romantic tale that is fun, emotional, and more realistic than half the dramas we get these days. However, the movie does not stop there, instead it ties in an adventure and blends it into all the aspects, making for a fun film. Once more, the whole tale revolves around the Mexican celebration of the day of the dead, bringing a unique take on the classic Halloween tale and providing a little education as well. 

The story isn't the only thing influenced by the Mexican culture though, the artistic style of the movie is also heavily influenced. The Book of Life is sort of a modern day Nightmare Before Christmas where CGI takes the place of stop motion animation. Many of the elements are similar, with the skeletons and landscapes sharp and angular to mirror the darkness of the afterlife. However, unlike Tim Burton, this director chose to liven things up a little by veering from the dark colors and adding wide splashes of colorful. This is not only to catch your eyes, but also to mirror the celebration that Day of the Dead is about and that life doesn't end as long as you are remembered. In the Underworld especially the color comes out, and the festivities are brought to full fold in the magical realm of the dead. Deep in the land of the Forgotten, the oblivion of elimination is presented by a frozen cavern where hope is nonexistent. Regardless, the worlds are diverse and fun, filled with ancient Central American influences that were a welcomed change. Even the characters have pizazz to them, each main character standing out in their own unique way. I in particular liked the Queen of the underworld, impressed with the blend of partying, happy, and death all wrapped into one package. The ruler of the Forgotten Land, was also of unique design, sharp, dark edges in shades of purple, neon green, and crimson to portray the darkness of his soul. 

What else makes this movie fun? The next aspect is the comedy, which for the most part is well timed and well delivered. There isn't much unique writing or witty humor in this movie, but more in how it is delivered. Countless puns are shouted in ridiculous voices, often followed by a character face planting into an object. What's even better is that the comedy is also diverse and spread out instead of following the typical style of beating a joke to death, the exception being Joaquin's obsession with mustaches. In addition to the comedy, the music also brings some thing to the film. Most of the numbers are covers of famous songs, some done horribly to be funny and others that are very relevant to the plot. A couple of the original numbers made my emotions go on a ride, as happiness, sadness, and even love all came together in the instruments and voice. Now most won't find it as powerful as Frozen, but for this reviewer it was nice having the music around the movie, not the opposite way around. Aside from the singing, the voice acting is incredible, each of the cast capturing the essence of the stereotypical Mexican character. Now there are too many to write about so let me pick my three favorites. First is Christina Applegate, the girl has got sass, spunk, and compassion all at work in her tour guide character. The girls sells the story as she uses the wooden puppets, which are represented in the character design, to craft the tale, keeping the kids in line, and yet showing empathy. Then there was Zoe Saldana who has the feisty Mexican girl zest that shows everyone girls don't need men to save them. Her voice is suave and full of passion, and exactly the buffer needed amidst the rowdy, rough voices of the cast. Finally the Queen of the Dead was my favorite character, and Kate del Castillo does a nice job bringing the character to life with flare, kindness, and the ability to hold her own. 

What can you take away from my sporadic rambling? The Book of Life is one of the better animated films I've seen in a while. It's Halloween fun, with colorful worlds and characters that balance out the predictable and limited tale. I strongly recommend seeing this movie in theaters, possibly in 3-D. I haven't had this much fun at the movies in quite some time, and I believe most will enjoy the adventure at hand. My scores for this film are: 

Animation/Adventure/Comedy: 9.5 Movie Overall: 9.0","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":67676,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2014-10-15","keywords":"afterlife,mexico,death character,bullfight,serenade","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi840674329","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk0Mjg3ODI5M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzM1NTA0MjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk0Mjg3ODI5M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzM1NTA0MjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Manolo, a young man who is torn between fulfilling the expectations of his family and following his heart, embarks on an adventure that spans three fantastical worlds where he must face his greatest fears.

programme.title: To, co zostaje
programme.desc: Marianna (Marta Ścisłowicz) i Jan (Piotr Czarniecki) wiodą szczęśliwe życie na wsi w północno-wschodniej Polsce. Pewnego dnia kobieta musi stawić czoła niespodziewanej śmierci męża. Wyrzuty sumienia i nagła strata sprawiają, że potrzebuje czasu, żeby pożegnać ukochanego. Zamyka się z jego ciałem w domu. Jej zachowanie spotyka się z niezrozumieniem mieszkańców wioski.

programme.title: Go
Go
programme.desc: Go: Directed by Doug Liman. With Katie Holmes, Sarah Polley, Suzanne Krull, Desmond Askew. The aftermath of a drug deal as told from three different points of view." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0139239/","name":"Go","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzJhNGExMDYtMWEyOS00MzMxLWJiYTYtMDYxNTRmNjdjM2VlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The aftermath of a drug deal as told from three different points of view.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0139239/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"socrates4"},"dateCreated":"2019-05-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Such Great Fun","reviewBody":"After PULP FICTION a lot of films tried to emulate its format. But none came close to matching its success. GO has clear elements of PULP FICTION in it, but it does its own thing at the same time. This is the right way to make a movie that may be inspired by another great film while still branching out on its own.\n\nThe story is great fun from the first frame to the last. The characters are fun and believable and there is a lot of great dialog here. Every time I watch it I continue to be impressed, even still after all these years. It never lets me down and it never once lets up even for a second. Highly recommend.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":70095,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1999-04-09","keywords":"multiple storyline,multiple perspectives,drugs,drug deal,sex","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Go","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1655308569","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDk5ZTIzM2MtMjU3MS00ZTgwLWJkYjEtODVmZDk0N2EyNGVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDk5ZTIzM2MtMjU3MS00ZTgwLWJkYjEtODVmZDk0N2EyNGVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Columbia Tristar"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001631/","name":"Sarah Polley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001542/","name":"Jay Mohr"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0937930/","name":"Scott Wolf"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0510731/","name":"Doug Liman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0070311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0060034/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0041864/","name":"John August"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: American Hero
American Hero
programme.desc:
American Hero: Directed by Nick Love. With Stephen Dorff, Eddie Griffin, Luis Da Silva Jr., Christopher Berry. Melvin, a reluctant Superhero, lives only for crime, women and drugs - until he realises that the only way he will ever get to see his estranged son is to go straight and fulfil his potential as a crime fighter." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4733536/","name":"American Hero","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxNDE2NDU5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE4MDczNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Melvin, a reluctant Superhero, lives only for crime, women and drugs - until he realises that the only way he will ever get to see his estranged son is to go straight and fulfil his potential as a crime fighter.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4733536/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dusantomsic"},"dateCreated":"2016-11-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great flick. Stays true to it's narration and characters.","reviewBody":"Griffin and Dorff are great. They deliver. Music fits, camera works. Urban landscape is realistic and true. I' don't know, but this movie surprised me.

Ignore the sucky reviews such as, just because someone expects Hancock mainstream money making style of a movie and then gives it bad review cause of that. Or I liked this one: "It says comedy, but it's not, so I gave this movie a bad mark".

Loose the expectations. Nothing dramatic happens, but its realistic enough with good acting, music, shots and screenplay to make it a solid movie that doesn't fail at the end. It most definitely does not suck and subjective remarks like that should not be implemented.

Peace","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4120,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Action","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-12-11","keywords":"non comic book superhero,superhero,father son relationship,reconciliation,female nudity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"American Hero","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1809562137","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjI0Y2IwZGEtMGVjMS00ODQ5LWEzNTktNjU1ZTFmODE3YmNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjI0Y2IwZGEtMGVjMS00ODQ5LWEzNTktNjU1ZTFmODE3YmNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for American Hero"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001151/","name":"Stephen Dorff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0341176/","name":"Eddie Griffin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1534888/","name":"Luis Da Silva Jr."}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0522393/","name":"Nick Love"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113509/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0522393/","name":"Nick Love"}],"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bone Eater
Zjadacz kości
Bone Eater
programme.desc:
Bone Eater: Directed by Jim Wynorski. With Bruce Boxleitner, Michael Horse, Adoni Maropis, Clara Bryant. Ancient Native American legend of the Bone Eater rises up and begins terrorizing the local townspeople." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0796306/","name":"Bone Eater","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3MjE2MjI4OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU5MTk5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ancient Native American legend of the Bone Eater rises up and begins terrorizing the local townspeople.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0796306/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"trashgang"},"dateCreated":"2012-05-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"just to see all those old actors again from the B-genre","reviewBody":"1986 brought us Chopping Mall from director Jim Wynorski, a classic in the genre. This here, Bone Eater won't be remembered. It contains a lot of very cheap and bad CGI but it's worth watching for the old thespians to see.

I guess that the budget went to the casting in stead of the effects. Main lead is by Bruce Boxleitner (Tron legacy (1982 and 2010)), but there are others to recogniz, Willam Katt from House (1986), Walter Koenig (from the Star Trak saga as Chekov),Veronica Hamel from Hill Street Blues (1981-1987) and Jim Storm from Dark Shadows (1966). 

The story itself was rather okay and the acting was also okay but the CGI teared it into a funny flick. To give you an example of cheap effects, the earthquakes were done by shaky camera's and you could easily see that the trees weren't moving. 

If you want to see the old brigade again than this is surely one to watch as a starter on a horror night with your pals. But if you think it will be a scary flick, forget it.

Gore 0/5 Nudity 0/5 Effects 0,5/5 Story 2/5 Comedy 0/5","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1227,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":2.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2008-02-09","keywords":"bone,worker,giant skeleton,relic,tomahawk","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000310/","name":"Bruce Boxleitner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0395398/","name":"Michael Horse"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0549538/","name":"Adoni Maropis"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0691061/","name":"Jim Wynorski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017447/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0691061/","name":"Jim Wynorski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0486610/","name":"William Langlois"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

Ancient Native American legend of the Bone Eater rises up and begins terrorizing the local townspeople." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0796306/","name":"Bone Eater","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3MjE2MjI4OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU5MTk5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ancient Native American legend of the Bone Eater rises up and begins terrorizing the local townspeople.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0796306/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"trashgang","dateCreated":"2012-05-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"just to see all those old actors again from the B-genre","reviewBody":"1986 brought us Chopping Mall from director Jim Wynorski, a classic in the genre. This here, Bone Eater won't be remembered. It contains a lot of very cheap and bad CGI but it's worth watching for the old thespians to see.

I guess that the budget went to the casting in stead of the effects. Main lead is by Bruce Boxleitner (Tron legacy (1982 and 2010)), but there are others to recogniz, Willam Katt from House (1986), Walter Koenig (from the Star Trak saga as Chekov),Veronica Hamel from Hill Street Blues (1981-1987) and Jim Storm from Dark Shadows (1966). 

The story itself was rather okay and the acting was also okay but the CGI teared it into a funny flick. To give you an example of cheap effects, the earthquakes were done by shaky camera's and you could easily see that the trees weren't moving. 

If you want to see the old brigade again than this is surely one to watch as a starter on a horror night with your pals. But if you think it will be a scary flick, forget it.

programme.title: The Riverbank
Na brzegu rzeki
The Riverbank
programme.desc: The Riverbank: Directed by John L'Ecuyer. With Rick Roberts, Kenneth Welsh, Kari Matchett, Cindy Doire. A woman returns to her hometown following the death of her fathers second wife, which leads her to uncover dark family secrets." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2124973/","name":"The Riverbank","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWZlOGEyYzMtNTE3OS00NmEyLTgyZmUtZjMyZjE2NTIwM2Y4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY5MTYzNDA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A woman returns to her hometown following the death of her fathers second wife, which leads her to uncover dark family secrets.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2124973/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"phatandys"},"dateCreated":"2015-12-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Kari Matchett Reigns Supreme","reviewBody":"A really good movie. Of course Kari Matchett again hits it out of the ballpark with her usual aplomb, her performance alone is worth the time invested. But Kari didn't have to do all the heavy lifting because the casting of this movie is unusually strong. Inga Cadranel shined as she stood out among a really fine acting lineup, usually there is always at least one actor'ess/character who is unable to keep up but this movie's cast is really solid. Writing never lost track of the pace, nor insulted us with tropes, the mood was almost noir-like and I appreciated the writers not resorting to the easy-out way with their story. The direction was on a Hollywood feature level and the production levels were tops. You can tell those associated with this movie were pros. I have to say this again, if Kari Matchett is cast in a TV/Movie it is must see viewing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":109,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"genre":["Mystery"],"datePublished":"2012-10-03","keywords":"open marriage,family secret,flashback,two word title","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0731519/","name":"Rick Roberts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0920564/","name":"Kenneth Welsh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0558182/","name":"Kari Matchett"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0478286/","name":"John L'Ecuyer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0389034/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0075779/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5249971/","name":"Genni Gunn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0524905/","name":"Graham Ludlow"}],"duration":"PT1H16M"}</script><metacontent="

Of course Kari Matchett again hits it out of the ballpark with her usual aplomb, her performance alone is worth the time invested. But Kari didn't have to do all the heavy lifting because the casting of this movie is unusually strong. Inga Cadranel shined as she stood out among a really fine acting lineup, usually there is always at least one actor'ess/character who is unable to keep up but this movie's cast is really solid. Writing never lost track of the pace, nor insulted us with tropes, the mood was almost noir-like and I appreciated the writers not resorting to the easy-out way with their story. The direction was on a Hollywood feature level and the production levels were tops. You can tell those associated with this movie were pros. I have to say this again, if Kari Matchett is cast in a TV/Movie it is must see viewing.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":109,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4,"genre":["Mystery"],"datePublished":"2012-10-03","keywords":"open marriage,family secret,flashback,two word title","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0731519/","name":"Rick Roberts","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0920564/","name":"Kenneth Welsh","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0558182/","name":"Kari Matchett"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0478286/","name":"John L'Ecuyer"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0389034/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0075779/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5249971/","name":"Genni Gunn","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0524905/","name":"Graham Ludlow"],"duration":"PT1H16M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Eye
Oko
The Eye
programme.desc: The Eye: Directed by David Moreau, Xavier Palud. With Jessica Alba, Alessandro Nivola, Parker Posey, Rade Serbedzija. Violinist Sydney Wells was accidentally blinded by her sister Helen when she was five years old. She submits to a cornea transplantation, and while recovering from the operation, she realizes that she is seeing dead people." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0406759/","name":"The Eye","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMyNjg3OTQyM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjkyMzU1MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Violinist Sydney Wells was accidentally blinded by her sister Helen when she was five years old. She submits to a cornea transplantation, and while recovering from the operation, she realizes that she is seeing dead people.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0406759/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"robertallenandersonjr"},"dateCreated":"2008-04-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not as bad as people make it sound","reviewBody":"The Eye was not a great movie but it's not horrible either. It was about an average movie. I was not expecting a lot going into seeing this movie. If you are expecting a lot going into this movie it will not be good but if your just looking to see a movie and thinking its going to be good you might actually like it. Pretty much the whole entire beginning and almost all of the middle was boring and just had very sudden scenes that would get you to jump out of your seat. The rest of the movie was when it started to kick up and get good. Jessica Alba finally started to find out what she had to do and what was going on with her and people around her. Thats when the action started and it had you on the edge of your seat. For the most part it was pretty slow moving and boring but then it kicked up it was good. If the first hour of the movie was like the end it would have of been an excellent movie. So if your looking for a pretty scary movie with lots of things that pop out at you go see this. The story was actually pretty good as well. The fact that it made you wait to find out why she became blind was well done. The acting job Jessica Alba did was good as well. The visual effects for this movie were also awesome.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":52791,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-10-29","keywords":"corneal transplant,eye,violinist,eye transplant,seeing dead people","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Eye","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi263323929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzAyNzkxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA4ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzAyNzkxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA4ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Eye Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004695/","name":"Jessica Alba"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005273/","name":"Alessandro Nivola"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000205/","name":"Parker Posey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1219963/","name":"David Moreau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0658837/","name":"Xavier Palud"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0179341/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012382/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0349406/","name":"Sebastian Gutierrez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1040327/","name":"Yuet-Jan Hui"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0161152/","name":"Oxide Chun Pang"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Mr. Jones
Mr. Jones
programme.desc:
Mr. Jones: Directed by Mike Figgis. With Richard Gere, Lena Olin, Anne Bancroft, Tom Irwin. After being arrested during a manic episode, a man who suffers from bipolar disorder is treated by a psychiatrist who begins to develop romantic feelings towards him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0107611/","name":"Mr. Jones","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDczYzlhOGUtZGQ1ZS00NTg1LWE4MjEtY2VkNDIzZWQzODZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjMwMjk0MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"After being arrested during a manic episode, a man who suffers from bipolar disorder is treated by a psychiatrist who begins to develop romantic feelings towards him.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0107611/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"clivy"},"dateCreated":"2005-08-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Something is happening here, but you don't know what it is, do you, Mr. Jones?","reviewBody":"I don't know very much about bipolar depression, aside from reading biographies of Robert Lowell, the poet. I have to say though that Richard Gere is outstanding in this movie. It started showing on ITV2 and his performance drew me into the story- I had to watch it to the end.

It's a brave premise for a Hollywood film but "Mr. Jones" is let down by a flawed script. I was offended by the way the doctor was portrayed. Of course she was played by a stunning actress, of course she became attached to her patient- to the point of invading his privacy by looking up his friends from his time at music college twenty years earlier. Oh, and of course (SPOILER- in more ways than one) she slept with him as well. She offers to resign which keeps her from being professionally ruined  sorry, but I can't see a qualified and experienced psychiatrist falling in love with her patient, let along sleeping with him while he's still under treatment. The ending peters out as well- to suggest that they will become a couple, I suppose.

The hospital scenes are strong and moving, as is the the subplot about the young student. This could have been an interesting study of people in emotional distress. IMDb data; ttnr: 0107611, Title: Mr. Jones, --- Description: Mr. Jones: Directed by Mike Figgis. With Richard Gere, Lena Olin, Anne Bancroft, Tom Irwin. After being arrested during a manic episode, a man who suffers from bipolar disorder is treated by a psychiatrist who begins to develop romantic feelings towards him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0107611/","name":"Mr. Jones","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDczYzlhOGUtZGQ1ZS00NTg1LWE4MjEtY2VkNDIzZWQzODZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjMwMjk0MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"After being arrested during a manic episode, a man who suffers from bipolar disorder is treated by a psychiatrist who begins to develop romantic feelings towards him.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0107611/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"clivy","dateCreated":"2005-08-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Something is happening here, but you don't know what it is, do you, Mr. Jones?","reviewBody":"I don't know very much about bipolar depression, aside from reading biographies of Robert Lowell, the poet. I have to say though that Richard Gere is outstanding in this movie. It started showing on ITV2 and his performance drew me into the story- I had to watch it to the end.

It's a brave premise for a Hollywood film but "Mr. Jones" is let down by a flawed script. I was offended by the way the doctor was portrayed. Of course she was played by a stunning actress, of course she became attached to her patient- to the point of invading his privacy by looking up his friends from his time at music college twenty years earlier. Oh, and of course (SPOILER- in more ways than one) she slept with him as well. She offers to resign which keeps her from being professionally ruined  sorry, but I can't see a qualified and experienced psychiatrist falling in love with her patient, let along sleeping with him while he's still under treatment. The ending peters out as well- to suggest that they will become a couple, I suppose.

The hospital scenes are strong and moving, as is the the subplot about the young student. This could have been an interesting study of people in emotional distress. Too bad they couldn't match Mr. Jones with unsentimental and uncompromising portraits of those trying to help him.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7114,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1993-10-08","keywords":"love,psychiatrist,bipolar disorder,concert,arrest","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000152/","name":"Richard Gere","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000565/","name":"Lena Olin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000843/","name":"Anne Bancroft"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001214/","name":"Mike Figgis"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066604/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0744839/","name":"Eric Roth","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0188165/","name":"Michael Cristofer"],"duration":"PT1H54M"</script><metacontent="
