IMDb data; ttnr: 9318280, Title: Driveways, --- Description: Driveways: Directed by Andrew Ahn. With Lucas Jaye, Hong Chau, Brian Dennehy, Laurent Rejto. A lonesome boy accompanies his mother on a trip to clean out his late aunt's house, and ends up forming an unexpected friendship with the retiree who lives next door." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9318280/","name":"Driveways","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2E4MGRmZDQtMTUxYy00OWE2LWE4ZGUtMGI0ZjI4MGUxMjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjA2OTE4OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A lonesome boy accompanies his mother on a trip to clean out his late aunt's house, and ends up forming an unexpected friendship with the retiree who lives next door.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9318280/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jdesando","dateCreated":"2020-05-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"A sweet film about the friendship between a boy and a man. Dennehy has rarely been better.","reviewBody":""Drive a little slower. Take your time. Take a good look at stuff." Del (Brian Dennehy)

Driveways is an internet film taking its time letting us know that friendship and love have no racial or age boundaries. We've seen this motif before: 8-year-old Cody befriends laconic octogenarian neighbor Del (it's not too much Gran Torino or UP) with the least sentimentality among the three and the least dialogue.

Yet, the love that envelops them, even with Cody's single Asian-American mom, Kathy (Hong Chau), who is not a stirring mother, is so unprepossessing that like Cody at his 9th birthday, life has happened in small increments, almost imperceptibly. The life including bullying kids and cleaning up a recently-deceased Aunt's mess of a home takes on a romantic sheen as the duo experience kindly neighbors and a comfortably-cleaned home.

In a small way it's like Seinfeld without the laughs-it's about nothing or rather the little things of life that begin to make up a happy life. Firecrackers in the backyard by the bully boys seem more like a celebration of a new life for Kathy and Cody than a bombardment. It's also a fine addition to the coming-of-age canon, a staple from Star Wars through Driveways.

It's one of Brian Dennehy's last roles (he recently died), but one of his finest because it doesn't require him to use his former football- player heft or his menacing sheriff mien as in First Blood. The friendship between Cody and veteran Del is the real deal. Del has one nostalgic speech that you wish more of because he is talking, as in the opening quote, about enjoying the small parts of life whether you're 8 or 80.

"Small" as in Driveways, where the titular constructions are more than the separation between suburban homes-they're what binds them.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5528,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3,"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-05-07","keywords":"friendship,dome magnifier,8 year old,8 year old boy,old man young boy relationship","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi825803033","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDgzYzNjODAtMjQ2NC00ZTgwLWE2NmItNjEyNTdmZThkYTM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDgzYzNjODAtMjQ2NC00ZTgwLWE2NmItNjEyNTdmZThkYTM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A lonesome boy accompanies his mother on a trip to clean out his late aunt's house, and ends up forming an unexpected friendship with the retiree who lives next door.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5102227/","name":"Lucas Jaye","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2186865/","name":"Hong Chau","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001133/","name":"Brian Dennehy"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3821224/","name":"Andrew Ahn"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0135778/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0464499/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0729964/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2314136/","name":"Hannah Bos","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3227768/","name":"Paul Thureen"],"duration":"PT1H23M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: La Nave del Olvido
Zapomniane drogi
La Nave del Olvido
programme.desc: La Nave del Olvido: Directed by Nicol Ruiz Benavides. With Rosa Ramírez, Romana Satt, Gabriela Arancibia, Cristóbal Ruiz. Claudina is a traditional woman from the countryside. After the pass away of her husband, she gets into a lonely routine. Having a difficult economic situation, Claudina has to move with her dearest grandson Cristóbal, and her daughter Alejandra, knowing that both women have a distanced relationship. Living together, Claudina meets the neighbor Elsa, an independent and married woman who sings on a hidden bar called "Porvenir" (The Future.) Claudina starts a relationship with Elsa, getting in love. Since then, she develops a journey of self-knowledge to be free, under the judgment of her daughter and friends on a religious and conservatory little town, obsessed with UFO sighting." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt12888166/","name":"La Nave del Olvido","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMThkMDJjNzktMGJmNy00OWMyLWI3ZjktNjczZTAzNTk1YTE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMzODQ4NzQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Claudina is a traditional woman from the countryside. After the pass away of her husband, she gets into a lonely routine. Kynodontas
programme.desc: Kynodontas: Directed by Yorgos Lanthimos. With Christos Stergioglou, Michele Valley, Angeliki Papoulia, Hristos Passalis. A controlling, manipulative father locks his three adult offspring in a state of perpetual childhood by keeping them prisoner within the sprawling family compound." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1379182/","name":"Kynodontas","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIyOTkyMDE5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjIwNzQwMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A controlling, manipulative father locks his three adult offspring in a state of perpetual childhood by keeping them prisoner within the sprawling family compound.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1379182/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"xfreakart"},"dateCreated":"2010-06-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"love or hate","reviewBody":"I was expecting some kind of "The Village" film... Just to avoid spoiling.. The lights turned on, the credits were running and everyone was quiet and searching for answers in others looks. Its best surprise that I've got in years. You don't have to be special to watch it, just sit and you'll end it living it, even that it isn't your life. I appreciate latter how good the movie was when I realized that all the scenes didn't need background violins to drive your emotions to a certain field. Everything goes by itself naturally. I just registered to post this, as I couldn't believe those bad reviews. I'm a normal guy that doesn't read reviews, but this movie is different and I was curious about how would other people feel about it. Maybe its one of those that you just love or hate, but at the end you'll feel something that isn't indifference.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":89615,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2009-11-11","keywords":"overprotective father,misuse of language,isolated house,child abuse,social isolation","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"A Guide to the Films of Yorgos Lanthimos","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi998160921","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTE0ODVhZTQtZDJlYS00NmRjLWI2ZTItODE0YTgwODhlOTllXkEyXkFqcGdeQW1hZGV0aXNj._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTE0ODVhZTQtZDJlYS00NmRjLWI2ZTItODE0YTgwODhlOTllXkEyXkFqcGdeQW1hZGV0aXNj._V1_.jpg","description":"Awkward adults, dark humor, and absurd circumstances: Welcome to the films of Yorgos Lanthimos. Honest and hard-working Texas rancher Homer Bannon has a conflict with his unscrupulous, selfish, arrogant and egotistical son Hud, who sank into alcoholism after accidentally killing his brother in a car crash." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0057163/","name":"Hud","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjA3MzFlZDQtNTY3Ny00OTM1LWI1ODctNmE4ZWM5ZTU2MjA5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Honest and hard-working Texas rancher Homer Bannon has a conflict with his unscrupulous, selfish, arrogant and egotistical son Hud, who sank into alcoholism after accidentally killing his brother in a car crash.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0057163/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"terencebells"},"dateCreated":"2018-04-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Hard Western Look","reviewBody":"I knew I had seen it, I had a black and white James Wong Howe Cinemascope memory and Paul Newman's body language. How he walks, how he stands. I remember thinking that Jake Gyllenhaal had borrowed that physicality for his character in "Brokeback Mountain" and I just realized that Larry McMurtry is the author of both "Brokeback Mountain" and "Hud". He provides us with a look into the modern cowboy that is not only unique but mesmerizing. Paul Newman's Hud is a cad and yet you feel we sense that behind the bravado hides a desperate man looking for something. Something personal and unspoken. Hud is one of my favorite Newman performances. Soulless and yet needy. Is it a coincidence that the only woman that"got away" from Hud is named Alma? - Alma in Spanish means soul - Alma is played by Patricia Neal with power and humanity and she won the Oscar for it. Melvyn Douglas also won the Oscar for his superb performance and Brandon de Wilde deserved one of his own. He is extraordinary. Hud has become an important film in my life and in future viewings in years to come I may discover why.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":20969,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"Passed","genre":["Drama","Western"],"datePublished":"1963-05-29","keywords":"rodeo cowboy,neo western,texas,rodeo,jack daniels","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2435365401","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzcwOTJlMWUtZWIxOS00NTJkLTk0YjUtYjE0MGNlOTZjNTdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRzdGFzaWVr._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzcwOTJlMWUtZWIxOS00NTJkLTk0YjUtYjE0MGNlOTZjNTdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRzdGFzaWVr._V1_.jpg","description":"Honest and hard-working Texas rancher Homer Bannon has a conflict with his unscrupulous, selfish, arrogant and egotistical son Hud, who sank into alcoholism after accidentally killing his brother in a car crash."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000056/","name":"Paul Newman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002048/","name":"Melvyn Douglas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0623658/","name":"Patricia Neal"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0728688/","name":"Martin Ritt"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057370/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0712419/","name":"Irving Ravetch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0290809/","name":"Harriet Frank Jr."},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0573505/","name":"Larry McMurtry"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Legendy miejskie 3
programme.desc: Twórcy serialu biorą na warsztat historie, które stały się częścią miejskiego folkloru, chociaż nikt nie wie, czy są prawdziwe. Opowiadają je na swój niepowtarzalny sposób.

programme.title: Les parfums
Zapachy
Les parfums
programme.desc: Les parfums: Directed by Grégory Magne. With Emmanuelle Devos, Grégory Montel, Zelie Rixhon, Sergi López. Anne Walberg is a celebrity in the perfume world. She creates fragrances and sells her incredible talent to companies of all kinds. She lives as a diva, selfish, well-tempered. Guillaume is her new driver and the only one who is not afraid to stand up to her. No doubt this is the reason why she does not fire him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11748354/","name":"Les parfums","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE3NzgyMDAtYzg1Ni00MWI0LWI0NGEtOTI1ZjRhZjBjZTY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODc0OTEyNDU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Anne Walberg is a celebrity in the perfume world. She creates fragrances and sells her incredible talent to companies of all kinds. She lives as a diva, selfish, well-tempered. Guillaume is her new driver and the only one who is not ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11748354/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"nagan2020"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"A refreshing comedy","reviewBody":"The story of a friendship between a selfish fragrance designer who is one of the best in her field, and her chauffeur who needs to cling to his job so that he can live with his daughter. There are no surprises or twists in the film, and everything falls into place where you expect it to. Even so, the chemistry between the two lead actors is so great that these cliches seem acceptable. A refreshing French comedy with a few laughs.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":963,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2020-07-01","keywords":"written by director,swimming pool,father daughter relationship,separated couple,9 year old girl","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-Annonce [VO]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1347141401","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2Q5OGI1MjAtOGQyZS00Y2UwLWE3MGQtZjRkMjY2YWQ2ZDVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2Q5OGI1MjAtOGQyZS00Y2UwLWE3MGQtZjRkMjY2YWQ2ZDVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0222922/","name":"Emmanuelle Devos"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2771436/","name":"Grégory Montel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8107538/","name":"Zelie Rixhon"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5046293/","name":"Grégory Magne"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0214233/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044140/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0125554/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5046293/","name":"Grégory Magne"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Taniec córki Boga
Sin-ui Ttal-eun Chum-eul Chun-da
programme.desc: Korea. Shin-mi, transpłciowa kobieta, tańczy w klubie gejowskim. Ma oddanych fanów i przyjaciół. Niestety świat, w którym nie ma szans poczuć się sobą, zaczyna się o nią upominać. Shin-mi dostaje wezwanie do wojska. Mimo wstydu chce walczyć o siebie pośród nieprzyjaznych ludzi.

programme.title: Di jiu tianchang
Żegnaj, mój synu
Di Jiu Tian Chang
programme.desc:
Di jiu tianchang: Directed by Xiaoshuai Wang. With Jingchun Wang, Mei Yong, Xi Qi, Roy Wang. Two married couples adjust to the vast social and economic changes taking place in China from the 1980s to the present." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9581076/","name":"Di jiu tianchang","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDQ2OTcwYTQtYmViZS00MjkzLWIwNTAtODUwMmJkYjZhMDE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzI1NzMxNzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two married couples adjust to the vast social and economic changes taking place in China from the 1980s to the present.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9581076/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"liuruiorp"},"dateCreated":"2019-12-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A dreamy observation of a changing nation","reviewBody":"In very many ways this film is almost a reboot of Zhang Yimou's film To Live, from 1994, which tells the many trials and tribulations of a family from the founding of the People's Republic in 1949 to the end of the Cultural Revolution in 1976. So Long My Son picks up that chronological baton, and tells a story about family bonds, the meaning of friendship and what constitutes our morals and ethics through the last 30/40 years of Chinese history, from a stilted, materially basic time of 1980 through to the hypermodernity of China in the 2010s.

In the same way To Live aimed thinly disguised critiques at the Chinese government's policies through showing its impact on ordinary people, So Long My Son fires a number of shots too and it's in fact a little surprising to me some of these have been overlooked by the censors. The most obvious of them is the criticism of the one child policy, but hidden in there too are mentions of the privatisation of state owned industries in the early 90s and the mass redundancies that went with them, as well as criticism of the wealth inequality of modern China that has ensued from the market economy transition of the 80s and 90s.

I'm unsure if this was a problem specific to the release version I saw, though I have seen other reviews saying the plot was hard to follow, but I noticed that the English subtitles was often only translating about 1/5 of the dialogue in Mandarin. As a speaker of both, I followed the plot and characters quite easily, but can absolutely understand why many reviewers and comments have said they found the characters and plots hard to distinguish if the subtitling was a problem. However, with one eye on the subtitles, I think the fact they were missing a lot of the Mandarin dialogue would have created a really dreamy plotline that complements well the cinematographic style deployed - long panoramic shots that suddenly cut into a character's perspective; languid sequences that soak in the environment; and shots designed to make the audience feel voyeurs in a private situation.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3740,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-03-22","keywords":"china,non linear,nonlinear timeline,hospital,loss of son","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OVS]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1042071321","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZThlNmFjNjAtNjkwZS00NTU1LWJkM2ItZGIyNmVlZDRmMGM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZThlNmFjNjAtNjkwZS00NTU1LWJkM2ItZGIyNmVlZDRmMGM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4592524/","name":"Jingchun Wang"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3619308/","name":"Mei Yong"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5035471/","name":"Xi Qi"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911075/","name":"Xiaoshuai Wang"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0514744/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4461717/","name":"Mei Ah"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911075/","name":"Xiaoshuai Wang"}],"duration":"PT3H5M"}</script><metacontent="

So Long My Son picks up that chronological baton, and tells a story about family bonds, the meaning of friendship and what constitutes our morals and ethics through the last 30/40 years of Chinese history, from a stilted, materially basic time of 1980 through to the hypermodernity of China in the 2010s.

However, with one eye on the subtitles, I think the fact they were missing a lot of the Mandarin dialogue would have created a really dreamy plotline that complements well the cinematographic style deployed - long panoramic shots that suddenly cut into a character's perspective; languid sequences that soak in the environment; and shots designed to make the audience feel voyeurs in a private situation.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3740,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-03-22","keywords":"china,non linear,nonlinear timeline,hospital,loss of son","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OVS]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1042071321","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZThlNmFjNjAtNjkwZS00NTU1LWJkM2ItZGIyNmVlZDRmMGM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZThlNmFjNjAtNjkwZS00NTU1LWJkM2ItZGIyNmVlZDRmMGM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4592524/","name":"Jingchun Wang","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3619308/","name":"Mei Yong","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5035471/","name":"Xi Qi"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911075/","name":"Xiaoshuai Wang"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0514744/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4461717/","name":"Mei Ah","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911075/","name":"Xiaoshuai Wang"],"duration":"PT3H5M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Black Beach
Czarny niedźwiedź
Black Bear
programme.desc: Black Beach: Directed by Esteban Crespo. With Raúl Arévalo, Paulina García, Candela Peña, Claude Musungayi. Carlos is a businessman who gets a request to intercede on behalf of a US engineer in the oil industry who's been kidnapped." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9660688/","name":"Black Beach","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTY5NzUxY2ItNjJlYy00NjNmLWI2ODAtZmMyZDU4OWU2MzFhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTM2Mzg4MA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Carlos is a businessman who gets a request to intercede on behalf of a US engineer in the oil industry who's been kidnapped.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9660688/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ridi-arahan"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's not always an easy task to decode about powerful people at powerful places","reviewBody":"What worked: The strongest aspect of the movie that caught my attention has to be the African culture that I was able to discover, at least superficially. Around half the movie is in Africa and that's fun to watch. The movie has an interesting screenplay that has a scope for a fine movie, if not a great one. What did not work: Screenplay was okay and the movie started fine. It went downwards afterwards. The narrative gets corrupted and mingled in between making it messier and unattractive. I think the movie could have been a better watch if the execution was done better. The editing and action sequences in Africa were not well choreographed. The movie had mediocre acting, an average plot execution making it a superficial project wanting to be smart and intelligent. The movie is not without plotholes. Final verdict: it's an okay movie about something familiar in an unfamiliar settings","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1392,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-09-25","keywords":"oil company,africa,african tribe,president,luxury","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Tráiler [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1263975961","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTFlNjdiZmItNDFmZi00MmQxLWI5NjAtODU1NzZmM2YxYTFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTFlNjdiZmItNDFmZi00MmQxLWI5NjAtODU1NzZmM2YxYTFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1666855/","name":"Raúl Arévalo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1257208/","name":"Paulina García"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0679150/","name":"Candela Peña"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1878916/","name":"Esteban Crespo"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0751468/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0573845/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0148641/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1878916/","name":"Esteban Crespo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2412547/","name":"David Moreno"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Art of the Steal
Sztuka kradzieży
The Art of the Steal
programme.desc: The Art of the Steal: Directed by Jonathan Sobol. With Kurt Russell, Matt Dillon, Jay Baruchel, Kenneth Welsh. Crunch Calhoun, a semi-reformed art thief, agrees to get his old gang back together to pull off one last heist." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2172985/","name":"The Art of the Steal","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjUxNjYyNTUxMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDgyMDcyMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Crunch Calhoun, a semi-reformed art thief, agrees to get his old gang back together to pull off one last heist.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2172985/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"michael-yates-88-308634"},"dateCreated":"2014-02-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fantastic Heist Movie...good Twist ...Loved it!","reviewBody":"If you love heist movies like me then you will love this one...without spoiling, it has all the ingredients for a good heist movie: protagonist is hard done by antagonist; trust is burnt; work together again for a big score; can they trust each other again? But what I like about this movies is the intricate story...there are things afoot and they're not twelve inches...Can you work it out? I had a rough idea without working out the details but I still loved it.... works much better than Now You See Me in my opinion...has a B grade movie feel but an A grade kick in the pants at the end...I do like Kurt Russell and Matt Dillon. And it is great to see Kenneth Welsh...A very Good Movie...","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":24210,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2014-06-20","keywords":"heist,thief,motorcycle,hiding in a car trunk,interpol","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Art of the Steal","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1849604633","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjk4OTE0OWUtODYyNS00MmYzLWJmNjYtZmZiNGI4ZTU1MWZlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjk4OTE0OWUtODYyNS00MmYzLWJmNjYtZmZiNGI4ZTU1MWZlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for The Art of the Steal"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000621/","name":"Kurt Russell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0059431/","name":"Jay Baruchel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0935395/","name":"Katheryn Winnick"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1038286/","name":"Jonathan Sobol"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0150452/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026545/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051618/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1038286/","name":"Jonathan Sobol"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Zapachy
Les parfums
programme.desc: Anne Walberg tworzy zapachy dla luksusowych marek. Zdaje sobie sprawę ze swoich uzdolnień, jest wymagająca i samolubna. Często zdarza jej się zachowywać kapryśnie. Na ogół nikt nie ośmiela się jej przeciwstawić. Wyjątkiem od tej reguły jest nowy szofer, Favre Guillaume. Początki ich współpracy są trudne.

programme.title: La nuit venue
Nocna jazda
La nuit venue
programme.desc: La nuit venue: Directed by Frédéric Farrucci. With Guang Huo, Camélia Jordana, Xun Liang, Maurice Cheng. One night, Noémie, a stripper and bewitching call girl, gets into Jin's cab. Intrigued by Jin's muteness, she asks him to become her official taxi. As the nights go by, a beautiful but dangerous love story develops between them." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9262952/","name":"La nuit venue","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTViZTAxODAtOWNkNy00ODAxLWFlNTEtODQ4MDc1NDk0ZTgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODc0OTEyNDU@._V1_.jpg","description":"One night, Noémie, a stripper and bewitching call girl, gets into Jin's cab. programme.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
Zakochany bez pamięci
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
programme.desc:
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind: Directed by Michel Gondry. With Jim Carrey, Kate Winslet, Gerry Robert Byrne, Elijah Wood. When their relationship turns sour, a couple undergoes a medical procedure to have each other erased from their memories." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0338013/","name":"Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY4NzcwODg3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTEwOTMyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When their relationship turns sour, a couple undergoes a medical procedure to have each other erased from their memories.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0338013/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rje58"},"dateCreated":"2004-03-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great, if you can relate...","reviewBody":"If you can relate to the underlying theme of love longed for, love given and received, and love lost, this is a great film. If you have come to understand that acceptance can -sometimes- be a great thing and not a compromise or a 'settle for' - this is a moving film.

As crazy and almost surreal as elements of this film are, it somehow remains honest and real. That seems like a contradiction... life is contradictory, isn't it?

Carrey and Winslet both turn in superb performances, as do the supporting cast. An incredible film that most of the people who 'get it' will love - but I suspect there will be more than a small percentage who won't understand it or can't relate to it and they will (understandably) dislike it."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":952534,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2004-03-19","keywords":"memory,loneliness,valentine's day,flashback,nonlinear timeline","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2292515097","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTA4YjQ5ZjEtMGQ4Mi00NWExLTkxMGQtNzAwYzVmNTU1ODJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTA4YjQ5ZjEtMGQ4Mi00NWExLTkxMGQtNzAwYzVmNTU1ODJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000120/","name":"Jim Carrey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000701/","name":"Kate Winslet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0929489/","name":"Tom Wilkinson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0327273/","name":"Michel Gondry"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042399/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017525/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017713/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0442109/","name":"Charlie Kaufman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0327273/","name":"Michel Gondry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1410028/","name":"Pierre Bismuth"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Assassin's Creed: Directed by Justin Kurzel. With Michael Fassbender, Marion Cotillard, Jeremy Irons, Brendan Gleeson. Callum Lynch explores the memories of his ancestor Aguilar de Nerha and gains the skills of a Master Assassin, before taking on the secret Templar society." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2094766/","name":"Assassin's Creed","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzE1OTczNTc1OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzgyMDI3MDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Callum Lynch explores the memories of his ancestor Aguilar de Nerha and gains the skills of a Master Assassin, before taking on the secret Templar society.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2094766/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"roderick_stout"},"dateCreated":"2017-01-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good, but not as good as it could've been","reviewBody":"As a fan of the game series, my expectations were quite high. I was therefore pleased to see that a lot of the movie can be related back to the games. The story features are similar as well as the historic atmosphere. The fighting scenes are nicely shown, but are a bit to dominant throughout the entire movie. The depth of the story can be better as well.

The actors do a good job, but there isn't much time to really get to know them.

All in all, a movie that did not disappoint me as an Assassins Creed fan, but not the best movie of the year either.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":192768,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2016-12-28","keywords":"based on video game,assassin,secret society,spain,spanish inquisition","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1056093721","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMyMzU3MzQ5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTkzMTYzMDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMyMzU3MzQ5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTkzMTYzMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"When Callum Lynch explores the memories of his ancestor Aguilar and gains the skills of a Master Assassin, he discovers he is a descendant of the secret Assassins society."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1055413/","name":"Michael Fassbender"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0182839/","name":"Marion Cotillard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000460/","name":"Jeremy Irons"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0997291/","name":"Justin Kurzel"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0109033/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2078681/","name":"Michael Lesslie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0177836/","name":"Adam Cooper"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0171651/","name":"Bill Collage"}],"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Lost World: Jurassic Park
Park Jurajski
Jurassic Park
programme.desc: The Lost World: Jurassic Park: Directed by Steven Spielberg. With Jeff Goldblum, Julianne Moore, Pete Postlethwaite, Arliss Howard. A research team is sent to the Jurassic Park Site B island to study the dinosaurs there, while an InGen team approaches with another agenda." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119567/","name":"The Lost World: Jurassic Park","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDFlMmM4Y2QtNDg1ZS00MWVlLTlmODgtZDdhYjY5YjdhN2M0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTI4MjkwNjA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A research team is sent to the Jurassic Park Site B island to study the dinosaurs there, while an InGen team approaches with another agenda.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119567/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"eternalsea"},"dateCreated":"2006-03-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very good sequel","reviewBody":"The Lost World is the sequel to the 1993 classic Jurassic Park. Whilst this film is not as good as the original it does stand up well as a sequel. Jeff Goldblum returns as Ian Malcolm. Malcolm has been asked to return to another Island were Dinosaurs have been allowed to live without cages. Malcolm refuses but when he finds out his paleontolagist girlfriend is already there he goes with a team of documentariens to rescue her. However several accidents ensue and they are left stranded on the Island with a second party. The film does not have the all round strength of the first and is far more dependant on thrills and its visual effects this time round. It does however succeed as good entertainment and its better than the third installment in the franchise by quite a bit. The Dino sequences are handled well with the Raptors in the long grass being the highlight of those and quite possibly the entire film. The T-rex features strongly again ( and this time there's two of them) along with a new and nasty little green dinosaur compsagnathus. The acting is'nt Oscar worthy or anything like it but the characters do have some charm and when they are put in danger you care what happens to them which is always a good sign. It does suffer a little from a bloated and anti climatic ending that is funny for about 2 minutes but I wont spoil it for you none the less. I give the Lost World its high rating because it does exactly what it sets out to do, entertain us. So I think its fair we overlook some of its flaws as with any kind of blockbuster sequel they are always there.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":395494,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1997-05-23","keywords":"dinosaur,costa rica,dog's death,blockbuster video,dog","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Jurassic Park Trilogy","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2525535257","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY5NzcwMDE4Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTY1MDg3NQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY5NzcwMDE4Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTY1MDg3NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jurassic Park, The Lost World: Jurassic Park and Jurassic Park III debut as a trilogy set on Blu-rayÂ™ October 25, 2011."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000156/","name":"Jeff Goldblum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000194/","name":"Julianne Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000592/","name":"Pete Postlethwaite"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000229/","name":"Steven Spielberg"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0437457/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000341/","name":"Michael Crichton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0462895/","name":"David Koepp"}],"duration":"PT2H9M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Edge of Tomorrow
Na skraju jutra
Edge of Tomorrow
programme.desc:
Edge of Tomorrow: Directed by Doug Liman. With Tom Cruise, Emily Blunt, Brendan Gleeson, Bill Paxton. A soldier fighting aliens gets to relive the same day over and over again, the day restarting every time he dies." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1631867/","name":"Edge of Tomorrow","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc5OTk4MTM3M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODcxNjg3MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A soldier fighting aliens gets to relive the same day over and over again, the day restarting every time he dies.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1631867/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lornloxor"},"dateCreated":"2014-05-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Witty and thrilling summer blockbuster with Tom Cruise in top form","reviewBody":"You could describe this movie as a dizzying combination of Groundhog Day, Starship Troopers, Source Code and The Butterfly Effect. Edge of Tomorrow borrows from these films and while some of the individual ideas may not therefore be groundbreakingly original, the way they're combined and put to use in Edge of Tomorrow by director Doug Liman certainly is. As aliens have invaded Earth, humanity's only hope lies in a cowardly PR officer Bill Cage (played by Tom Cruise) with no combat skills who is sent to the front lines. His only advantage? A save point, sort of. Are you excited yet? You should be. I don't want to tell you more specifics about the plot because it's best to experience and discover this great piece of work yourself. 

You have to love Tom Cruise as an actor, he always gives his roles a 100 percent and he's phenomenal in Edge of Tomorrow - Physical, funny and determined. I'd say this is his best performance since Collateral. Emily Blunt is fantastically badass as the poster girl of the war, Rita Vrataski. This is her first real action film and she knocks it out of the park. Cruise and Blunt also have great chemistry together. Bill Paxton and Brandon Gleeson give great supporting performances and most of the supporting soldiers have distinct personalities even with their limited screen times. 

Edge of Tomorrow's world building is slick and credible. The CGI and the special effects are seamless and bring the great set pieces and the relentless aliens to life. The action is really exhilarating (the cool exoskeleton suits definitely help here) and the script is very witty and inventive as it needs to be when you're dealing with time travel (or time resets if you will). Despite its action thrills Edge of Tomorrow finds plenty of room for character development both for Cruise and Blunt. The script also manages to pull off some quite funny scenes (especially in the training segment). I also have to mention James Herbert's snappy editing because it's that good. The the situations could get old really fast if it wasn't for the fast-paced editing that concisely and freshly shows the differences in each repetition Cruise goes through. The pacing is absolutely relentless and there isn't a boring moment in the film. 

The tone of the film is pretty much perfect for a summer blockbuster. It's not overly morose or gloomy despite the backdrop of an alien invasion. Instead it opts for wit, fun and action thrills. I was really gripped from start to finish and I had this big grin on my face when I left the theater. I really liked the other recent blockbusters in Godzilla and X-Men: Days of Future Past but Edge of Tomorrow surpasses them both. If only every summer blockbuster was such good fun.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":633454,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2014-06-04","keywords":"time loop,alien,alien invasion,dying repeatedly,combat","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"IMAX Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3591679257","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY0Mjk4MTI0MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjQyNjE4MTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY0Mjk4MTI0MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjQyNjE4MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A soldier fighting in a war with aliens finds himself caught in a time loop of his last day in the battle, though he becomes better skilled along the way.
"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000129/","name":"Tom Cruise"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1289434/","name":"Emily Blunt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000200/","name":"Bill Paxton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0510731/","name":"Doug Liman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108864/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0449458/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003160/","name":"Christopher McQuarrie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125336/","name":"Jez Butterworth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3890871/","name":"John-Henry Butterworth"}],"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Enemy of the State
Wróg publiczny
Enemy of the State
programme.desc:
Enemy of the State: Directed by Tony Scott. With Will Smith, Gene Hackman, Jon Voight, Lisa Bonet. A lawyer becomes targeted by a corrupt politician and his N.S.A. goons when he accidentally receives key evidence to a politically motivated crime." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120660/","name":"Enemy of the State","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWI0Y2NhMzMtYTE5ZS00MDlhLTg0ZjEtMjAwZmEwNTc0ODc2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0OTQ0OTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A lawyer becomes targeted by a corrupt politician and his N.S.A. goons when he accidentally receives key evidence to a politically motivated crime.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120660/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"neilmac"},"dateCreated":"2003-12-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Crackerjack Thriller with a message...","reviewBody":"Why? Well for starters there is the best chase sequence since The French Connection. Then there is Will Smith as an actor - not just a star, though later in the movie he is admittedly overshadowed by veteran Gene Hackman.

There are two layers to this movie: On the surface is a pacy thriller with edge-of-the-seat chases but underneath lies a telling commentary on government surveillance. It is one of those truth-in-fiction stories which makes its point about government intrusion into privacy dramatically and effectively.

There are references to the classic, The Conversation: The surveilled couple talking in the park, and the Hackman character's premises are an obvious recreation of his workshop in the earlier movie. If you haven't yet seen The Conversation - see it before you see this one - you will understand the Hackman character a lot better (besides, it is a superb movie in its own right).

Oh, and Jon Voight is terrific as the bad guy...","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":235012,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1999-02-24","keywords":"on the run,conspiracy,nsa,surveillance,national security agency","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Enemy of the State","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi384368921","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDlmZjZmZTAtOGE4My00ZWFkLTlmMmQtMTM5NTFhNTNkMTIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDlmZjZmZTAtOGE4My00ZWFkLTlmMmQtMTM5NTFhNTNkMTIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Buena Vista Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000432/","name":"Gene Hackman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000685/","name":"Jon Voight"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001716/","name":"Tony Scott"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049348/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026281/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0102770/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0545861/","name":"David Marconi"}],"duration":"PT2H12M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Gone in Sixty Seconds
60 sekund
Gone in Sixty Seconds
programme.desc:
Gone in Sixty Seconds: Directed by Dominic Sena. With Nicolas Cage, Giovanni Ribisi, Angelina Jolie, T.J. Cross. A retired master car thief must come back to the industry and steal fifty cars with his crew in one night to save his brother's life." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0187078/","name":"Gone in Sixty Seconds","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTIwMzExNDEwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwODMxMzg2._V1_.jpg","description":"A retired master car thief must come back to the industry and steal fifty cars with his crew in one night to save his brother's life.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0187078/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bowmanblue"},"dateCreated":"2017-01-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Gone, but not forgotten","reviewBody":"Also, poor Nicholas Cage, I knew him well... Once upon a time (possibly in Las Vegas) he was a Box Office heavyweight. Now... well, you can probably pick up one of his latest films from those buckets you find of DVDs for £2.99 in petrol stations. However, before his decent into depressingly-bad cinema, he made some pretty fun films. Yes, he's won an Oscar in his time for his deep and meaningful acting, but you won't find any of that here. Just fun.

Nicholas Cage plays (basically) Nicholas Cage – only a Nicholas Cage who used to steal expensive cars, only to retire. However, his loose cannon of a brother steals (or doesn't steal – I forget – it doesn't matter!) for (or from) the wrong mobster in L.A. meaning Nicholas Cage the now not-so retired car thief must steal a load of flash motors in one night or his brother ends up in the car crusher (literally!).

If you like fast cars driving even faster (and, judging by the 'Fast and the Furious' franchise a lot of people do) then this one is basically for you. It's an action film and it's pretty much by the numbers, but, when it's such fun, who cares? Everyone cranks their performances up to eleven and it all comes across as one of those adorable eighties and nineties 'over-the-top' action flicks (yes, I know it was made it in 2000, but it sure feels like a nineties movie) with a real cartoony vibe to it. You have Christopher Ecleston plays the 'evil Brit villain' much like any other evil Brit villains you've seen in cinema. Vinnie Jones and Angelina Jolie are on hand to show their faces, but feel a little underused for what they could have been.

Ultimately, it's all on Nicholas Cage's manic shoulders and he does the film proud. It's loud, dumb and it's basically one long car crash that you'll probably be unable to tear your eyes away from.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":268704,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2000-06-09","keywords":"auto theft,car,brother,thief,theft","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001401/","name":"Angelina Jolie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000610/","name":"Giovanni Ribisi"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0784061/","name":"Dominic Sena"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049348/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026281/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0355181/","name":"H.B. Halicki"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003298/","name":"Scott Rosenberg"}],"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

Nicholas Cage plays (basically) Nicholas Cage – only a Nicholas Cage who used to steal expensive cars, only to retire. However, his loose cannon of a brother steals (or doesn't steal – I forget – it doesn't matter!) for (or from) the wrong mobster in L.A. meaning Nicholas Cage the now not-so retired car thief must steal a load of flash motors in one night or his brother ends up in the car crusher (literally!).

If you like fast cars driving even faster (and, judging by the 'Fast and the Furious' franchise a lot of people do) then this one is basically for you. It's an action film and it's pretty much by the numbers, but, when it's such fun, who cares? Everyone cranks their performances up to eleven and it all comes across as one of those adorable eighties and nineties 'over-the-top' action flicks (yes, I know it was made it in 2000, but it sure feels like a nineties movie) with a real cartoony vibe to it. You have Christopher Ecleston plays the 'evil Brit villain' much like any other evil Brit villains you've seen in cinema. Vinnie Jones and Angelina Jolie are on hand to show their faces, but feel a little underused for what they could have been.

Ultimately, it's all on Nicholas Cage's manic shoulders and he does the film proud. It's loud, dumb and it's basically one long car crash that you'll probably be unable to tear your eyes away from.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":268704,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2000-06-09","keywords":"auto theft,car,brother,thief,theft","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001401/","name":"Angelina Jolie","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000610/","name":"Giovanni Ribisi"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0784061/","name":"Dominic Sena"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049348/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026281/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0355181/","name":"H.B. programme.title: The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift
Szybcy i wściekli: Tokio Drift
The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift
programme.desc:
The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift: Directed by Justin Lin. With Lucas Black, Damien Marzette, Trula M. Marcus, Zachery Ty Bryan. A teenager becomes a major competitor in the world of drift racing after moving in with his father in Tokyo to avoid a jail sentence in America." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0463985/","name":"The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2NTMxODEyNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDgxMjA0MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A teenager becomes a major competitor in the world of drift racing after moving in with his father in Tokyo to avoid a jail sentence in America.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0463985/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CinemaCocoa"},"dateCreated":"2017-04-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"No rats in buckets, no CGI, just an entertaining flick featuring excellent car racing","reviewBody":"Branching away from any original cast members of the first two films, thankfully, Tokyo Drift provides a refreshingly new look to the franchise.

Tokyo Drift is possibly my favourite of the series, or at least its up there with the first film; it only has a few problems that can be swept under the "It's Fast and the Furious, what do you expect" carpet. The story follows American "teenager" Sean Boswell (Lucas Black) whose reckless driving lands him prison time, but to avoid this he moves in with his father in Tokyo. He attempts to move on a dangerous rival's girl, and must become a competitor in the street racing's drifting scene.

I say "teenager" as that's what IMDb says, and he does go to school in the movie but honestly, he's the oldest teen I've ever seen. Along with every other "teen" in this movie! While I talk negatives, the majority of the film is set in Tokyo yet 95% of the dialogue is English and Sean has a knack of meeting every foreigner in the city. I don't mind this so much, but I fully expect all of the Japanese characters to speak Japanese, especially when Sean isn't present!

But, unlike 2 Fast 2 Furious (choke) this film actually cares for its characters and their personalities (as Sean says early on: "It's not about the ride, it's about the rider") from Sean's fish-out-of- water acceptance, to his mentor Han's closet of skeletons. The villain isn't ridiculous either, his uncle is part of the Yakuza and he has a serious "king of a little hill" problem. Again unlike 2 Fast 2 Furious (gag) the cars have never looked better, sleek and refined and the drifting action is spectacular, especially when synchronized. Plus, no CGI, just skilled professional drivers, making the film worth seeing solely for the racing.

There's no stupid Tyrese Gibson mugging at the camera, no rats in buckets, no CGI, just an entertaining (albeit poorly localized) flick featuring excellent car racing and professional stunts.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":258134,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2006-08-23","keywords":"yakuza,chase,showdown,dominic toretto character,han seoul oh character","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Everything We Know About 'F9'","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2943402009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzk5ODI0YjUtN2VkYy00YTgyLTg5NGQtYmE1MzQ4MTVhOTA3XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFsZWxvZw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzk5ODI0YjUtN2VkYy00YTgyLTg5NGQtYmE1MzQ4MTVhOTA3XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFsZWxvZw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"On this IMDbrief we put the pedal to the metal on the Fast Saga and everything you need to know about 'F9' (2021)."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0085407/","name":"Lucas Black"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0117022/","name":"Zachery Ty Bryan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0510168/","name":"Shad Moss"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0510912/","name":"Justin Lin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011134/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0604555/","name":"Chris Morgan"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

A suburban family moves to a new neighborhood with their large, yet lovable Great Dane, who has a tendency to wreak havoc in his own oblivious way." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1392197/","name":"Marmaduke","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2ZkMGNmMmUtYzVlZS00YTNmLTg1YTUtMGZkN2I1NGMwNWY0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDgyODgxNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A suburban family moves to a new neighborhood with their large, yet lovable Great Dane, who has a tendency to wreak havoc in his own oblivious way.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1392197/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"barrys82"},"dateCreated":"2010-08-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Its strange but I enjoy it","reviewBody":"Marmaduke is the adaptation to movies of the cartoon of the same name. The story is about a suburban family moves to a new neighborhood with their large yet lovable Great Dane, who has a tendency to wreak havoc in his own oblivious way. Marmaduke is mainly intended for little kids, some adults may enjoy it others might feel light a living hell. The movie has some funny moments and others are kinda foolish. The CGI to make the animals talk are nothing out of this world but decent enough. The story is a little predictable. The cast of voices are the best thing with Owen Wilson as Marmaduke, Fergie as Jezebel, Kiefer Sutherland as Bosco and George Lopez as Carlos. We also have Lee Pace and Judy Greer as Phil and Debbie Winslow, Marmaduke's owners and William H. Macy as Pace's boss. In conclusion, Kids will love Marmaduke and for one strange reason I enjoy it. So if you have children and a very big patience, take them to see this movie. programme.title: Laws of Attraction
Pozew o miłość
Laws of Attraction
programme.desc: Laws of Attraction: Directed by Peter Howitt. With Pierce Brosnan, Julianne Moore, Michael Sheen, Parker Posey. Amidst a sea of litigation, two New York City divorce lawyers find love." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0323033/","name":"Laws of Attraction","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEzODg4MjM1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNzQzNTI3._V1_.jpg","description":"Amidst a sea of litigation, two New York City divorce lawyers find love.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0323033/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Chris_Docker"},"dateCreated":"2004-05-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Loads of talent do not a story make up for","reviewBody":"It's great to see Julianne Moore in a comedy role again, reminding us of the not inconsiderable range of her talents. Laws of Attraction is a rather well-worn comedy though that lacks sparkle. Two top divorce layers battle it out and eventually get romantic about each other. If the script sizzled it might be able to hold a candle, but it doesn't - which is a great shame given the great performances (Pierce Brosnan also does well, appearing far less wooden than in his James Bond roles). The whole film has a rather contrived feel to it that no amount of acting talent can salvage. Throwing in a bit of Irish countryside seems gratuitous in the extreme, a bit of cutesiness for the American box-office.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22874,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2004-09-29","keywords":"neo screwball comedy,workplace romance,coworker relationship,using others,love","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Laws of Attraction","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2744451353","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODYwNGRlNDQtNzljNS00ZGE5LWI5NWEtZjE0NGM3YTVmNDU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODYwNGRlNDQtNzljNS00ZGE5LWI5NWEtZjE0NGM3YTVmNDU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from New Line Cinema"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000112/","name":"Pierce Brosnan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000194/","name":"Julianne Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000205/","name":"Parker Posey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0398185/","name":"Peter Howitt"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054516/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0088199/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011877/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0112459/","name":"Aline Brosh McKenna"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0363326/","name":"Robert Harling"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Land of the Dead
Ziemia żywych trupów
Land of the Dead
programme.desc:
Land of the Dead: Directed by George A. Romero. With Simon Baker, John Leguizamo, Dennis Hopper, Asia Argento. The living dead have taken over the world, and the last humans live in a walled city to protect themselves as they come to grips with the situation." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0418819/","name":"Land of the Dead","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzU1MDI1NDM1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzU5OTkyMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The living dead have taken over the world, and the last humans live in a walled city to protect themselves as they come to grips with the situation.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0418819/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Li-1"},"dateCreated":"2005-07-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"For me, it's definitely the worst of the Living Dead films and ruins Romero's otherwise solid track record in the zombie genre.","reviewBody":"Rating: * 1/2 out of **** 

Land of the Dead has been long-awaited for a good two decades. Set presumably some time after Day of the Dead, the plot focuses on a human population that has managed to survive by barricading themselves within the "remains" of Pittsburgh by means of guards and electrified fences (as well as rivers that are bordering the city). The rich reside in a tower called Fiddler's Green but everyone else is forced to live in the streets, with only the false hope of being able to attain high-class status.

One guy dissatisfied with living in the streets, Cholo (John Leguizamo), doesn't take kindly to the mayor's (Dennis Hopper) refusal, especially having been his lackey for three years with the expectation of reward. So Cholo steals the armored vehicle Dead Reckoning and threatens to destroy Fiddler's Green unless he gets his five million dollars (which is the amount needed to get high-class status, but did he really expect to be welcomed into Fiddler's Green with open arms after this incident?). Refusing to cooperate, the mayor hires Riley (Simon Baker) to bring Dead Reckoning back. Meanwhile, the undead are planning to invade the city thanks to the evolving zombie called Big Daddy, and given this couldn't happen at a worst possible time, you can guess what'll happen next.

I'm going to put it bluntly, this film is by far the worst of Romero's zombie movies, lacking in so many ways that I would still feel the same way even if I didn't have its predecessors to compare it with. But there are its predecessors, and having already seen three prior films in which characters must hold off scores of zombies at bay from inside some "safe" location before it's ultimately penetrated by the undead, let's just say seeing this a fourth time gets a little repetitive.

The film does have elements worth appreciating, the cinematography is excellent and easily the best of the series; I especially loved the stylish and creepy nighttime shot of zombies shuffling within a fog-shrouded forest. The movie is also the most action-packed of the series, so the non-stop gunfire keeps the movie watchable. The production values are also pretty good considering the budgetary limitations (some of the f/x still look pretty weak, though).

Otherwise, LOTD is rushed, unfulfilling, and does little its predecessors haven't already accomplished. What new material it does aim for is poorly conceived, a shocker considering Romero's had twenty years to mull over this material. Take the city, for instance, it's never fully explained how the monetary system works or where the electricity is coming from. I was able to suspend my disbelief for the latter in Dawn of the Dead, but I'm not willing to let Romero pull the same trick twice, especially when the inner workings of the city should have been further explored. 

The movie's social commentary feels like a slapdash effort of contemporary issues tossed together without any real coherency, with characters acting in blatantly idiotic fashion for no other purpose than to continue serving the commentary. The original Dawn of the Dead's commentary on consumerism worked because it was a natural outgrowth of the way the characters' believably behaved (if you had free reign to a mall, you likely wouldn't want to leave, would you?).

Yet here, Romero feels compelled to ensure that Hopper's character won't dare negotiate, even preferring to leave the city (to go where exactly?) and kill an associate rather than give up five million bucks. To keep the commentary going, Romero even has Hopper take all his cash with him, even though I had to wonder what it was good for. Considering his demands, the same problem also applies to Cholo. Are there other cities/outposts out there using the same currency as well? If so, why not at least mention it so we don't question the characters' motivations, especially considering it's the basic framework that leads to so many deaths later in the film.

There are further instances of stupidity, such as Riley choosing not to warn anyone inside the city about Big Daddy. The soldiers protecting the city prove incompetent in almost every fashion, with one guard actually rappelling into a crowd of zombies. Later in the film, there's even a guy who wears headphones while he's outside the city, by himself, and not at all far from known zombie territory. This scene is also indicative of the countless jump scares Romero attempts, all of them obvious and hilariously overdone.

As for the zombies, there's the storyline involving Big Daddy, an undead gas station attendant who's inexplicably getting smarter. Much of the appeal of zombies is seeing them act out as mindless drones with no other motivation than to eat human flesh. That Big Daddy is able to think and seems to actually want revenge for his fallen zombie brethren completely mutes the sense of dread and terror that came with zombies acting on just pure instinct. 

Most astoundingly, Romero takes this a step further and actually wants us to sympathize with the zombies. I shouldn't be surprised by this development, as it's all been clearly leading up to this point since Bub's humanity in Day of the Dead and the constant "they're us, we're them" lines. Doesn't mean I have to like it, especially when the previous installments have made it clear being a zombie isn't something to cherish and the general fact that they like to eat people doesn't exactly make me want to side with them. For me, LOTD continues Romero's downward spiral, and I still haven't liked a movie of his since the 80s."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":94659,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2005-08-24","keywords":"zombie apocalypse,post apocalypse,zombie film,zombie survival,survival horror","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Land of the Dead","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1419051289","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODZhYWUxMDQtNWMzOC00ZjM2LWI2ZWEtNjliNzU5YjEwYThlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODZhYWUxMDQtNWMzOC00ZjM2LWI2ZWEtNjliNzU5YjEwYThlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000491/","name":"John Leguizamo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000782/","name":"Asia Argento"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048932/","name":"Simon Baker"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001681/","name":"George A.
